meanings.definition: Walk quietly and carefully on one's toes.
meanings.sent1: She was tiptoeing around the house to avoid waking up her parents.
meanings.sent2: The cat was tiptoeing across the room, trying not to make a sound.
meanings.sent3: The ninja tiptoed through the room, trying to be as silent as a mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was tiptoeing with excitement as she approached the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The tiptoeing ballet dancer moved gracefully across the stage.

meanings.sent1: The spy was tiptoeing through the dark alley, keeping an eye out for any danger.
meanings.sent2: He tiptoed into the room, careful not to disturb anyone.
meanings.sent3: The tiptoeing raccoon snuck into the campsite and stole some snacks.
meanings.sent4: The fog tiptoed in, enveloping the city in a mysterious haze.
meanings.sent5: The tiptoeing thief made his way through the museum, looking for valuable artifacts.

meanings.definition: To stand or walk on tiptoe.
meanings.sent1: The children were tiptoeing to peek over the fence and see the parade.
meanings.sent2: She tiptoed on the edge of the cliff to get a better view of the sunset.
meanings.sent3: The tiptoeing giraffe reached for the leaves on the tall tree.
meanings.sent4: The sun tiptoed below the horizon, painting the sky in shades of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The tiptoeing toddler tried to reach the cookie jar on the high shelf.
